listitem.para: #define GLM_MAT4_IDENTITY_INIT
#define GLM_MAT4_ZERO_INIT
#define GLM_MAT4_IDENTITY ((mat4)GLM_MAT4_IDENTITY_INIT)
#define GLM_MAT4_ZERO ((mat4)GLM_MAT4_ZERO_INIT)
#define glm_mat4_udup(mat, dest) glm_mat4_ucopy(mat, dest)
#define glm_mat4_dup(mat, dest) glm_mat4_copy(mat, dest)
#define glm_mat4_inv_precise(mat, dest) glm_mat4_inv(mat, dest)
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_ucopy (mat4 mat, mat4 dest)
copy all members of [mat] to [dest]
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_copy (mat4 mat, mat4 dest)
copy all members of [mat] to [dest]
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_identity (mat4 mat)
make given matrix identity. It is identical with below, but it is more easy to do that with this func especially for members e.g. glm_mat4_identity(aStruct->aMatrix);
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_identity_array (mat4 *__restrict mat, size_t count)
make given matrix array's each element identity matrix
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_zero (mat4 mat)
make given matrix zero.
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_pick3 (mat4 mat, mat3 dest)
copy upper-left of mat4 to mat3
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_pick3t (mat4 mat, mat3 dest)
copy upper-left of mat4 to mat3 (transposed)
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_ins3 (mat3 mat, mat4 dest)
copy mat3 to mat4's upper-left
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_mul (mat4 m1, mat4 m2, mat4 dest)
multiply m1 and m2 to dest
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_mulN (mat4 *__restrict matrices[], uint32_t len, mat4 dest)
mupliply N mat4 matrices and store result in dest
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_mulv (mat4 m, vec4 v, vec4 dest)
multiply mat4 with vec4 (column vector) and store in dest vector
CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat4_trace (mat4 m)
trace of matrix
CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat4_trace3 (mat4 m)
trace of matrix (rotation part)
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_quat (mat4 m, versor dest)
convert mat4's rotation part to quaternion
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_mulv3 (mat4 m, vec3 v, float last, vec3 dest)
multiply vector with mat4
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_transpose_to (mat4 m, mat4 dest)
transpose mat4 and store in dest
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_transpose (mat4 m)
tranpose mat4 and store result in same matrix
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_scale_p (mat4 m, float s)
scale (multiply with scalar) matrix without simd optimization
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_scale (mat4 m, float s)
scale (multiply with scalar) matrix
CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat4_det (mat4 mat)
mat4 determinant
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_inv (mat4 mat, mat4 dest)
inverse mat4 and store in dest
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_inv_fast (mat4 mat, mat4 dest)
inverse mat4 and store in dest
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_swap_col (mat4 mat, int col1, int col2)
swap two matrix columns
CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_swap_row (mat4 mat, int row1, int row2)
swap two matrix rows
CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat4_rmc (vec4 r, mat4 m, vec4 c)
helper for R (row vector) * M (matrix) * C (column vector)

section.title: GLM_MAT4_IDENTITY_INIT

para.computeroutput: #define GLM_MAT4_IDENTITY_INIT

section.para: Most of functions in this header are optimized manually with SIMD if available. You dont need to call/incude SIMD headers manually

section.title: glm_mat4_inv()

para.computeroutput: CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_inv (mat4 mat, mat4 dest)

para.para: inverse mat4 and store in dest

section.para: Definition at line 618 of file mat4.h.

section.title: glm_mat4_inv_fast()

para.computeroutput: CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_inv_fast (mat4 mat, mat4 dest)

para.para: inverse mat4 and store in dest

section.para: this func uses reciprocal approximation without extra corrections e.g Newton-Raphson. this should work faster than normal, to get more precise use glm_mat4_inv version.
NOTE: You will lose precision, glm_mat4_inv is more accurate
Definition at line 681 of file mat4.h.

section.title: glm_mat4_mul()

para.computeroutput: CGLM_INLINE void glm_mat4_mul (mat4 m1, mat4 m2, mat4 dest)

para.para: multiply m1 and m2 to dest

section.para: m1, m2 and dest matrices can be same matrix, it is possible to write this:

literallayout.computeroutput: mat4 m = GLM_MAT4_IDENTITY_INIT; glm_mat4_mul(m, m, m);

section.para: Definition at line 299 of file mat4.h.

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: matrices parameter is pointer array not mat4 array!

section.title: glm_mat4_rmc()

para.computeroutput: CGLM_INLINE float glm_mat4_rmc (vec4 r, mat4 m, vec4 c)

para.para: helper for R (row vector) * M (matrix) * C (column vector)

section.para: rmc stands for Row * Matrix * Column
the result is scalar because R * M = Matrix1x4 (row vector), then Matrix1x4 * Vec4 (column vector) = Matrix1x1 (Scalar)
Definition at line 748 of file mat4.h.
